intro: Mapouria ankafinensis, commonly known as the Madagascar mapouria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas of the forest. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
